title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Begins Testing its AS-1 Rocket Engine
summary:
POLARIS Spaceplanes has successfully ignited its 1kN AS-1 aerospike rocket engine that will power its MIRA demonstrator. MIRA is 4.3 metres long and is powered by four jet engines and one rocket engine. MIRA is a subscale demonstrator of the company’s AURORA multipurpose spaceplane and hypersonic transport system. Once operational, AURORA will be capable of […]
The post POLARIS Spaceplanes Begins Testing its AS-1 Rocket Engine appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: China conducts launch to test satellite internet capabilities
summary: China sent an undisclosed number of satellites into orbit Thursday to test satellite internet technologies.

title: Canada Assigns Joshua Kutryk To Starliner-1 Crew
summary: The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) has selected Joshua Kutryk to serve on the Starliner-1 crew, a upcoming long duration ISS mission.

title: California Lawmakers Urge NASA Not To Cut Mars Sample Return Funding
summary: Six members of California’s congressional delegation sent a letter to NASA Adminstrator Bill Nelson today urging him not to scale back Mars Sample Return funding right now. Saying they are […]

title: Canada Assigns Jenni Gibbons To Artemis II Backup Crew
summary: The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) has selected Jenni Gibbons to serve on the Artemis II Backup Crew.

title: China’s Landspace aims to build a stainless steel rocket
summary: Chinese launch startup Landspace has unveiled plans to develop a reusable stainless steel rocket.

title: Sierra Space Completes First Dream Chaser, Lays Off 165 Employees
summary: Just days after announcing the completion of Tenacity, Sierra Space confirmed on November 17th that it had laid off 165 employees who had been instrumental in assembling the Tenacity.

title: Viasat warns satellite power limit review would hurt GEO innovation
summary: A proposal to review satellite transmission power limits risks curtailing investments and innovation in geostationary orbit where space companies such as Viasat operate, an executive for the operator warned.

title: NASA Concerned SpaceX HLS To Require "High Teens" Number Of Launches For Artemis Mission
summary: SpaceX's proposed concept of operations for the Starship lunar lander under the Human Landing System (HLS) program involves multiple launches of the Starship/Super Heavy system, which will require rapid turn around of both Starship launch facilities.
